full_text:
IN THE COURT OF THE SESSIONS JUDGE,
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
PRESENT : SMT. NAZEERA.S, SESSIONS JUDGE
Monday, 3% day of March, 2025/ 12â„¢ day of Phalguna, 1946.
CRIMINAL M.C. No.614/2025
(Crime No.190/2025 of Kallambalam Police Station)
Petitioners /Accused :-
1 Akhiljith A.U., aged 28 years,
S/o.Ajithkumar, 6/196,
A.U. Nivas, Mavinmoodu,
Kallambalam, Thiruvannathapuram.
2 Liju Lal, aged 22 years, S/o Lalumon,
Laiju Bhavan, Clavar, Vadasserikonam.
(By Advocate S. Shameel)
Counter Petitioner:-
State of Kerala
(By Public Prosecutor Dr. T. Geenakumari)
This Crl.M.C. came up for hearing on 1/3/2025 and the court on the
3/3/2025 passed the following :
ORDER
This is an application filed under Section 482 of the Bharatiya
Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, seeking pre-arrest bail.

2. The petitioners are alleged to have committed the offences
punishable under Sections 296(b), 126(2), 115(2) and 117(2) r/w Section
3(5)of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and Crime No.190/2025 of
Criminal M.C.No.614/2025 1/2

Kallambalam Police Station is registered against the petitioners, arraying
them as accused.

3. Heard. On a perusal of the report submitted by the Investigating
Officer, it is found that all the offences alleged against the petitioners are
bailable. As per section 482 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, the condition
precedent for invoking the powers provided under the said provision is that
the petitioner apprehends that he might be arrested on accusation of having
committed a non-bailable offence. In this circumstance, the application
cannot be entertained.

In the result, the petition is dismissed as not maintainable,
without prejudice to the right of the petitioners to take bail from the
Jurisdictional Court.

Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by him, corrected and
pronounced by me in Open Court on this the 3" day of March, 2025.
Sd/-
NAZEERA.S
SESSIONS JUDGE
(Copies : 4) True Copy By Order
Typed by: Anupama
Compared by: Rifa FCS : SHERISTADAR
